column1: The prehistory of San Luis Obispo County is strongly influenced by the Chumash people. There has been significant settlement here at least as early as the Millingstone Horizon thousands of years ago. Important settlements existed in coastal areas such as Morro Bay and Los Osos.Mission San Luis Obispo de Tolosa was founded on September 1
column2: 1772 in the area that is now the city of San Luis Obispo. The namesake of the mission
column3: city and county is Saint Louis of Toulouse
column4: the young bishop of Toulouse (Obispo and Tolosa in Spanish) in 1297.

column1: San Luis Obispo County was one of the original counties of California

a region that figures strongly in several John Steinbeck novels
column3: stretches north from San Luis Obispo County. The remote California Valley near Soda Lake is the region most untouched by modernity. Travels through this area and the hills east of Highway 101 during wildflower season often include wine tasting at numerous wineries.

column1: San Luis Obispo County's economy is primarily a service economy. Service jobs account for 38% of the County's jobs
column2: government jobs accounts for 20.7%
column3: and manufacturing jobs represent 6% of the County's jobs.

column1: San Luis Obispo County is the third largest producer of wine in California
column2: surpassed only by Sonoma and Napa counties. Wine grapes are the second largest agricultural crop in the county (after strawberries)
column3: and the wine production they support creates a direct economic impact and a growing wine country vacation industry.

column1: The county led the state in hemp cultivation in 2018 as hundreds of acres of the crop were grown in research partnerships. In 2019
column2: nine agricultural research permits were still active. Sixteen commercial permits were issued before a temporary ban on new applications running through June 2020 was passed by the Board of Supervisors.

San Luis Obispo County leaned toward the Republican Party in presidential and congressional elections during the most of the 20th century; it has
column2: however
column3: become more Democratic during the 2000s and 2010s. In 2008
column4: Barack Obama won the county with 51.2 percent of the vote.  Prior to 2008
column5: the last Democrat to win a majority in the county was Lyndon Johnson in 1964
column6: although Bill Clinton won a plurality in 1992. In 2012
column8: this time with a slim plurality of the vote.

column1: County voters supported Republican Meg Whitman in 2010 and Democrat Jerry Brown in 2014. The previous Democrat to carry the county in a gubernatorial election was Gray Davis in 1998.
With respect to the United States House of Representatives
column2: San Luis Obispo County is in California's  24th congressional district
column3: represented by Democrat Salud Carbajal. From 2003 until 2013
column4: the county was split between the Bakersfield-based 22nd district
column5: which was represented by Republican Kevin McCarthy and included Paso Robles and most of the more conservative inland areas of the county
column7: a strip which included most of the county's more liberal coastal areas as well as coastal areas of Santa Barbara and Ventura counties.

column1: With respect to the California State Senate
column2: the county is in the  17th Senate District
column3: represented by Democrat Bill Monning.  With respect to the California State Assembly
column4: the county is in the  35th Assembly District

column1: San Luis Obispo County Regional Airport (SBP) is located just south of the City of San Luis Obispo. Commercial flights are available.

column2: CAL-FIRE and the Estrella Warbirds Museum.

column1: Oceano County Airport (L52) is located on the coast in the 5 Cities area.
